item.title: Affiliated clubs in Hampshire
item.description:
There are a number of local walking clubs in Hampshire that are affiliated to the Ramblers. To find out more, contact the secretary directly.

Aldershot and District Ramblers Club, 40 St Michael’s Road, Sandhurst, GU47 8HE

Basingstoke Ramblers Club https://www.basingstokeramblers.org.uk basrammembership@yahoo.com(Membership Secretary)

Bursledon Rights of Way & APG, Orchard Hill, Salterns Lane, Old Bursledon, SO31 8DH

Christchurch Area NT Ramblers, 23 Lentune Way, Lymington, SO413PE

Everton Rambling Club, 6 Mulberry Grove, Everton, Lymington, SO41 0ZN

item.title: Area committee 2025-26
item.description:
The following officers were elected at the AGM on 14 February. To send an email, simply click on the officer’s name.

  • Chair: Richard Eve (Winchester)
  • Secretary: Mike Peacock (Andover)
  • Treasurer: Steven Little (Winchester)
  • Membership Secretary: Vacant
  • Walking Environment Officer: Richard Kenchington (Eastleigh)
  • Footpath Officer: Alan Marlow (Winchester)
  • Access Officer: Les Mildon (Romsey)
  • Digital Officer: Peter Jordan (Winchester)

item.title: Area Council
item.description:
In the Ramblers, the Area serves as the vital strategic bridge between our local walking Groups, the national Central Office and our local highway authorities, currently Hampshire County Council, Portsmouth City Council and Southampton City Council.

The Role of Hampshire Area

We are one of 59 Areas across Great Britain. While local Groups focus on inspecting and maintaining paths, organising group walks or running local campaigns; the Area Council has a more strategic role. Our main functions include:

item.title: Area Groups
item.description:
In Hampshire there are 131 area and 2 age-related groups.

Map of Hampshire, showing the ‘range’ of each local group

Area Groups

Explore our local groups across the county:

  • Alton
  • Andover
  • Eastleigh
  • Hampshire 20s & 30s
  • Hampshire 40+
  • Meon
  • New Forest
  • North-East Hampshire
  • North Hampshire Downs
  • Portsmouth
  • Romsey
  • Southampton
  • South-East Hampshire
  • Waltham
  • Winchester

As well as our 15 groups there are a number of local walking clubs in Hampshire that are affiliated to the Ramblers.

item.title: Find a walk
item.description:
When you join the Ramblers, we encourage you to join a local group. You’ll then be part of a local community of walkers and rights of way volunteers. You’ll be invited to join a mailing list to get alerts of upcoming group walks.

But, as a member, you’ll find a welcome at Ramblers group walks throughout Hampshire and, indeed, the country.

item.title: Footpaths & RoW
item.description:
Hampshire County Council is the Highways Authority for most of our area and has lots of information about Rights of Way in the county:

  • Using public rights of way
  • The Definitive map of public rights of way

Hampshire County Council publishes temporary Rights of Way closures and diversions, together with other changes or disruptions on its Map of Public Rights of Way. Look for the routes marked in red and click on the route).
